intro: Kibara ellipsoidea, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its thick, velvety leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb, often with a rosette-forming habit. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Kibara ellipsoidea is widely cultivated as an ornamental plant for its vibrant blossoms and compact growth form.
